title: European intelligence services adapt to the upheavals of the Trump era
subhead: Shaken by Donald Trump's unpredictable behavior, European intelligence services, long reliant on the United States, are tightening their cooperation.

title: Ukraine says Abu Dhabi talks with Russia 'substantive and productive'
Last US-Russia nuclear treaty ends in 'grave moment' for world
French far right's EU embezzlement was 'directed by' Le Pen, prosecutors argue
subhead: Prosecutors at Marine Le Pen's appeal trial requested a four-year prison sentence and a five-year ban on being elected to office for the far-right leader, describing her as 'the instigator, following her father, of a system that allowed her to embezzle â‚¬1.4 million.'

title: 'Trump put liberal democracy in the crosshairs in 2025, he might pull the trigger in 2026'
subhead: The recent dramatic moves by the Trump administration reveal an intent to bring down both domestic and international systems, argues David J. Simon, senior lecturer in international affairs at Yale University.

title: Michael Jackson film reveals previously unheard clips of thoughts on children
subhead: A new documentary airing in the UK on Wednesday features previously unheard audio of the late singer describing troubling insight into his relationship with children. Jackson, who died in 2009, faced multiple allegations of child sex abuse during his lifetime.

title: Ukraine's 'grandfathers' go to war
subhead: The Ukrainian army has an average age of 45, significantly older than European standards. The draft has targeted men between the ages of 25 and 60, which contrasts with recruitment practices typically seen in Western countries.

Between Putin and Trump, a similarity born of hatred, contempt and revisionism
subhead: Both ideologically and in the methods they used to achieve their goals, the Russian and American presidents display common traits that are cause for grave concern for democracy across the Atlantic.

title: One month after Maduro's abduction in Venezuela, the transition of power is unclear
subhead: While Delcy Rodriguez, whom Donald Trump approved to replace Nicolas Maduro at the start of January, appears to be meeting Washington's expectations, it is still impossible to know whether this situation will open up space for democracy.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Artificial snow takes a toll on the environment
subhead: The Milan Cortina Olympic Games are no exception: Artificial snowmaking will be used almost everywhere. This technology, which requires large amounts of water and energy, has led to major infrastructure changes that have been criticized by environmental advocates and scientists.
